item.title: Matt add a quote by Murray Krieger
item.description: "The existential realm is, from the standpoint of propositional structure, a raging chaos." -- Murray Krieger

item.title: Matt add a quote by Rainer Maria Rilke
item.description: "The purpose of life is to be defeated by greater and greater things." -- Rainer Maria Rilke

item.title: Matt add a quote by Quentin Crisp
item.description: "Muddled syntax is the outward and audible sign of confused minds, and the misuse of grammar the result of illogical thinking." -- Quentin Crisp

item.title: Matt add a quote by Philip K. Dick
item.description: "It is sometimes an appropriate response to reality to go insane." -- Philip K. Dick

item.title: Matt add a quote by Giorgio Agamben
item.description: "The coming being is whatever being." -- Giorgio Agamben

item.title: Matt add a quote by Carl Schmitt
item.description: "The exception is more interesting than the rule. The rule proves nothing; the exception proves everything. In the exception the power of real life breaks through the crust of a mechanism that has become torpid by repetition." -- Carl Schmitt

item.title: Matt add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Let the words be gazetted and ridiculous henceforward." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Matt add a quote by Anonymous
item.description: "Love is patient; love is kind and envies no one. Love is never boastful, nor conceited, nor rude; never selfish, not quick to take offense. Love keeps no score of wrongs; does not gloat over other men's sins, but delights in the truth. There is nothing love cannot face; there is no limit to its faith, its hope, and endurance. [....] In a word, there are three things that last forever: faith, hope, and love; but the greatest of them all is love." -- Anonymous

item.title: Matt add a quote by William James
item.description: "I am no lover of disorder and doubt as such. Rather I fear to lose truth by the pretension to possess it already wholly." -- William James

item.title: Matt add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "The appearance of the other in the world corresponds therefore to a congealed sliding of the whole universe." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Matt add a quote by Dmitri Shostakovich
item.description: "When a man is in despair, it means that he still believes in something." -- Dmitri Shostakovich

item.title: Matt add a quote by Murray Krieger
item.description: "The aesthetic can have its revenge upon ideology by revealing a power to complicate that is also a power to undermine." -- Murray Krieger

item.title: Matt add a quote by Bertrand Russell
item.description: "To teach how to live without certainty, and yet without being paralyzed by hesitation, is perhaps the chief thing that philosophy, in our age, can still do for those who study it." -- Bertrand Russell
